info.title: EmailEngine
info.description: You will need an Access Token to use this API (generate one here). When making API calls remember that requests against the same account are queued and not executed in parallel. If a previous request takes too much time to finish, a queued request might time out before EmailEngine can run it.

get.description: Lists registered accounts

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (zero indexed, so use 0 for first page)

get.description: Try to discover IMAP and SMTP settings for an email account

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address to discover email settings for

get.description: List blocklists with blocked addresses

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (zero indexed, so use 0 for first page)

get.description: Stream account state changes as an EventSource
Lists registered gateways

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (zero indexed, so use 0 for first page)

get.description: Get active license information

post.description: Set up a license for EmailEngine to unlock all features

get.description: Lists registered OAuth2 applications

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (zero indexed, so use 0 for first page)

post.description: Registers a new OAuth2 application for a specific provider

get.description: Lists messages in the Outbox

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (zero indexed, so use 0 for first page)

get.description: List setting values for specific keys

post.description: Set setting values for specific keys

get.description: Lists stored templates for the account

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Account ID to list the templates for

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (zero indexed, so use 0 for first page)

get.description: Lists access tokens registered for root access
Returns stored information about the account. Passwords are not included.

delete.description: Stop syncing IMAP account and delete cached values

get.description: List blocked addresses for a list

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: List ID. Must use a subdomain name format. Lists are registered ad-hoc, so a new identifier defines a new list.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (zero indexed, so use 0 for first page)

post.description: Add an email address to a blocklist

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: List ID. Must use a subdomain name format. Lists are registered ad-hoc, so a new identifier defines a new list.

delete.description: Delete a blocked email address from a list

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: List ID. Must use a subdomain name format. Lists are registered ad-hoc, so a new identifier defines a new list.

parameters.name: recipient
parameters.description: Email address to remove from the list

get.description: Returns stored information about the gateway. Passwords are not included.

get.summary: Return IMAP logs for an account
get.description: Output is a downloadable text file
Returns stored information about an OAuth2 application. Secrets are not included.
Lists messages in a mailbox folder

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (zero indexed, so use 0 for first page)

parameters.name: documentStore
parameters.description: If enabled then fetch the data from the Document Store instead of IMAP

put.description: Update message information for matching emails

get.description: Lists all available mailboxes

parameters.name: counters
parameters.description: If true, then includes message counters in the response

get.description: Get the active OAuth2 access token for an account. NB! This endpoint is disabled by default and needs activation on the Service configuration page.
Check delivery test status
Retrieve template content and information
Lists access tokens registered for an account
Returns details of a specific message. By default text content is not included, use textType value to force retrieving text

parameters.name: maxBytes
parameters.description: Max length of text content. This setting is ignored if `documentStore` is `true`.

parameters.name: textType
parameters.description: Which text content to return, use * for all. By default text content is not returned.

parameters.name: embedAttachedImages
parameters.description: If true, then fetches attached images and embeds these in the HTML as data URIs

parameters.name: documentStore
parameters.description: If enabled then fetch the data from the Document Store instead of IMAP

put.description: Update message information. Mainly this means changing message flag values

delete.description: Move message to Trash or delete it if already in Trash

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Delete message even if not in Trash

get.description: Fetches attachment file as a binary stream
Retrieves message text

parameters.name: maxBytes
parameters.description: Max length of text content. This setting is ignored if `documentStore` is `true`.

parameters.name: textType
parameters.description: Which text content to return, use * for all. By default all contents are returned.

parameters.name: documentStore
parameters.description: If enabled then fetch the data from the Document Store instead of IMAP

get.description: Fetches raw message as a stream

post.description: Registers new IMAP account to be synced
Provisions a new access token for an account
Checks if can connect and authenticate using provided account info
Generates a redirect link to the hosted authentication form
Create a new stored template. Templates can be used when sending emails as the content of the message.
Filter messages from a mailbox folder by search options. Search is performed against a specific folder and not for the entire account.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Mailbox folder path. Not required if `documentStore` is `true`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (zero indexed, so use 0 for first page)

parameters.name: documentStore
parameters.description: If enabled then fetch the data from the Document Store instead of IMAP

parameters.name: exposeQuery
parameters.description: If enabled then returns the ElasticSearch query for debugging as part of the response

post.description: Upload a message structure, compile it into an EML file and store it into selected mailbox.
Submit message for delivery. If reference message ID is provided then EmailEngine adds all headers and flags required for a reply/forward automatically.

delete.description: Remove a message from the outbox
Delete all stored templates for an account

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Must be true in order to flush templates

put.description: Requests account syncing to be run immediatelly
Move messages matching to a search query to another folder
Move messages to Trash or delete these if already in Trash

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Delete messages even if not in Trash

status.description: HTTP status code for the OAuth2 request

clientId.description: OAuth2 client ID used to authenticate this request

tokenRequest.description: OAuth2 error info if token request failed

email.description: Default email address of the account

secure.description: Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 993

count.description: Count of blocked addresses in this list

deliveries.description: Count of email deliveries using this gateway

hostname.description: Hostname or environment this license applies to

active.description: Is there an active license registered

legacy.description: `true` for older OAuth2 apps set via the settings endpoint

created.description: The time this entry was added

updated.description: The time this entry was updated

includeInListing.description: Is the application listed in the hosted authentication form

clientId.description: Client or Application ID for 3-legged OAuth2 applications

clientSecret.description: Client secret for 3-legged OAuth2 applications. Actual value is not revealed.

authority.description: Authorization tenant value for Outlook OAuth2 applications

serviceClient.description: Service client ID for 2-legged OAuth2 applications

serviceKey.description: PEM formatted service secret for 2-legged OAuth2 applications. Actual value is not revealed.

response.description: Response from the SMTP server. Only if state=processing

source.description: How this message was added to the queue

created.description: The time this message was queued

scheduled.description: When this message is supposed to be delivered

attemptsMade.description: How many times EmailEngine has tried to deliver this email

attempts.description: How many delivery attempts to make until message is considered as failed

localAddresses.description: A list of pooled local IP addresses that can be used for IMAP and SMTP connections

webhooksEnabled.description: If false then do not emit webhooks

trackSentMessages.description: If true, then rewrite html links in sent emails to track opens and clicks

resolveGmailCategories.description: If true, then resolve the category tab for incoming emails

inboxNewOnly.description: If true, then send "New Email" webhooks for incoming emails only

serviceSecret.description: HMAC secret for signing public requests

authServer.description: URL to fetch authentication data from

proxyEnabled.description: Is the global proxy enabled or not

notifyText.description: Include message text in webhook notification

gmailEnabled.description: If true then do not show Gmail account option (deprecated)

outlookEnabled.description: If true then do not show Outlook account option (deprecated)

mailRuEnabled.description: If true then do not show Mail.ru account option (deprecated)

imapStrategy.description: How to select local IP address for IMAP connections

smtpStrategy.description: How to select local IP address for SMTP connections

smtpServerProxy.description: Enable PROXY Protocol for SMTP server

smtpServerPassword.description: SMTP client password. Set to null to disable.

smtpServerTLSEnabled.description: Enable TLS for the SMTP interface. Requires a valid certificate.

imapProxyServerHost.description: IMAP Proxy Host to bind to

imapProxyServerProxy.description: Enable PROXY Protocol for the IMAP proxy server

imapProxyServerPassword.description: IMAP proxy client password. Set to null to disable.

imapProxyServerTLSEnabled.description: Enable TLS for the IMAP proxy interface. Requires a valid certificate.

queueKeep.description: How many completed or failed queue entries to keep

templateHeader.description: HTML code displayed on the top of public pages like the hosted authentication form

connectError.description: Connection failed due to technical error

ConnectionsStats.description: Counts of accounts in different connection states

created.description: The time this template was created

updated.description: The time this template was last updated

useAuthServer.description: Set to true to use authentication server instead of username/password

secure.description: Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 993

disabled.description: Set to true to disable IMAP handling

sentMailPath.description: Upload sent message to this folder. By default the account's Sent Mail folder is used. Set to `null` to unset.

draftsMailPath.description: Folder for drafts. By default the account's Draft Mail folder is used. Set to `null` to unset.

junkMailPath.description: Folder for spam. By default the account's Junk Mail folder is used. Set to `null` to unset.

trashMailPath.description: Folder for deleted emails. By default the account's Trash folder is used. Set to `null` to unset.

useAuthServer.description: Set to true to use authentication server instead of username/password

secure.description: Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 465

email.description: Default email address of the account

copy.description: Copy submitted messages to Sent folder

notifyFrom.description: Send webhooks for messages starting from provided date. The default is the account creation date.

syncFrom.description: Sync messages to document store starting from provided date. If not set, all emails are synced.

source.description: Which mechanism was used to add the entry

remoteAddress.description: Which IP address triggered the entry

userAgent.description: Which user agent triggered the entry

created.description: The time this entry was added or updated

deliveries.description: Count of email deliveries using this gateway

secure.description: Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 465

legacy.description: `true` for older OAuth2 apps set via the settings endpoint

created.description: The time this entry was added

updated.description: The time this entry was updated

includeInListing.description: Is the application listed in the hosted authentication form

clientId.description: Client or Application ID for 3-legged OAuth2 applications

clientSecret.description: Client secret for 3-legged OAuth2 applications. Actual value is not revealed.

authority.description: Authorization tenant value for Outlook OAuth2 applications

serviceClient.description: Service client ID for 2-legged OAuth2 applications

serviceKey.description: PEM formatted service secret for 2-legged OAuth2 applications. Actual value is not revealed.

accounts.description: The number of accounts registered with this application. Not available for legacy apps.

encodedSize.description: Encoded size of the attachment. Actual file size is usually smaller depending on the encoding

embedded.description: Is this image used in HTML img tag

inline.description: Should this file be included in the message preview somehow

contentId.description: Usually used only for embedded images

plain.description: How many bytes for plain text

html.description: How many bytes for html content

emailId.description: Globally unique ID (if server supports it)

draft.description: Is this message marked as a draft

flagged.description: Is this message marked as flagged

subject.description: Message subject (decoded into unicode, applies to other string values as well)

preview.description: Text preview for messages loaded from Document Store

messages.description: Count of messages in mailbox as reported by the STATUS command

unseen.description: Count of unseen messages in mailbox as reported by the STATUS command

listed.description: Was the mailbox found from the output of LIST command

subscribed.description: Was the mailbox found from the output of LSUB command

specialUse.description: Special use flag of the mailbox if set

mainSig.description: Primary DKIM signature. `status.aligned` should be set, otherwise DKIM check should not be considered as passed.

previewText.description: Preview text appears in the inbox after the subject line

created.description: The time this template was created

updated.description: The time this template was last updated

MessageHeaders.description: Object where header key is object key and value is an array

id.description: Pointer to message text content. The value is `null` for messages retrieved from Document Store.

hasMore.description: If partial message content was requested then this value indicates if it includes all the content or there is more

date.description: Time the bounce was registered by EmailEngine

emailId.description: Globally unique ID (if server supports it)

threadId.description: Thread ID (if server supports it). Always set for messages retrieved from Document Store.

draft.description: Is this message marked as a draft

flagged.description: Is this message marked as flagged

subject.description: Message subject (decoded into unicode, applies to other string values as well)

isAutoReply.description: True if this message was detected to be an autoreply email like the Out of Office notice

hasMore.description: Is the current text output capped or not

useAuthServer.description: Set to true to use authentication server instead of username/password

secure.description: Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 993

disabled.description: Set to true to disable IMAP handling

sentMailPath.description: Upload sent message to this folder. By default the account's Sent Mail folder is used. Set to `null` to unset.

draftsMailPath.description: Folder for drafts. By default the account's Draft Mail folder is used. Set to `null` to unset.

junkMailPath.description: Folder for spam. By default the account's Junk Mail folder is used. Set to `null` to unset.

trashMailPath.description: Folder for deleted emails. By default the account's Trash folder is used. Set to `null` to unset.

useAuthServer.description: Set to true to use authentication server instead of username/password

secure.description: Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 465

authorize.description: Return a redirect link to the OAuth2 consent screen

authority.description: Outloook account type. Either 'consumers', 'organizations', 'common' or an organizartion ID

account.description: Account ID. If the provided value is `null` then an unique ID will be autogenerated

email.description: Default email address of the account

path.description: Check changes only on selected path

copy.description: Copy submitted messages to Sent folder. Set to `null` to unset and use provider specific default.

notifyFrom.description: Send webhooks for messages starting from provided date. The default is the account creation date.

syncFrom.description: Sync messages to document store starting from provided date. If not set, all emails are synced.

state.description: Is the account new or updated existing

secure.description: Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 465

state.description: Is the gateway new or updated existing

clientId.description: Client or Application ID for 3-legged OAuth2 applications

serviceClient.description: Service client ID for 2-legged OAuth2 applications

serviceKey.description: PEM formatted service secret for 2-legged OAuth2 applications

authority.description: Authorization tenant value for Outlook OAuth2 applications

Model13.description: HTTP referrer allowlist for API requests

error.description: Error messages for IMAP verification. Only present if success=false

code.description: Error code. Only present if success=false

error.description: Error messages for SMTP verification. Only present if success=false

code.description: Error code. Only present if success=false

listed.description: Was the mailbox found from the output of LIST command

subscribed.description: Was the mailbox found from the output of LSUB command

specialUse.description: Special use flag of the mailbox if set

account.description: Account ID. If the provided value is `null` then an unique ID will be autogenerated. Using an existing account ID will update settings for that existing account.

email.description: Default email address of the account

syncFrom.description: Sync messages to document store starting from provided date. If not set, all emails are synced.

notifyFrom.description: Send webhooks for messages starting from provided date. The default is the account creation date.

redirectUrl.description: The user will be redirected to this URL after submitting the authentication form

type.description: Display the form for the specified account type (either "imap" or an OAuth2 app ID) instead of allowing the user to choose

url.description: Generated URL to the hosted authentication form

recipient.description: Email address to add to the list

added.description: Was the address added to the list

previewText.description: Preview text appears in the inbox after the subject line

account.description: Account ID. Use `null` for public templates.

created.description: Was the template created or not

seq.description: Sequence number range. Not allowed with `documentStore`.

answered.description: Check if message is answered or not

deleted.description: Check if message is marked for being deleted or not

draft.description: Check if message is a draft

unseen.description: Check if message is marked as unseen or not

flagged.description: Check if message is flagged or not

seen.description: Check if message is marked as seen or not

modseq.description: Matches messages with modseq higher than value. Not allowed with `documentStore`.

emailId.description: Match specific Gmail unique email UD

threadId.description: Match specific Gmail unique thread UD

gmailRaw.description: Raw Gmail search string. Will return an error if used for other account types.

DocumentQuery.description: Document Store query. Only allowed with `documentStore`.

MailboxPath.description: Mailbox path as an array or a string. If account is namespaced then namespace prefix is added by default.

inline.description: If true, then blockquotes the email that is being replied to

forwardAttachments.description: If true, then includes attachments in forwarded message

ignoreMissing.description: If true, then processes the email even if the original message is not available anymore

documentStore.description: If enabled then fetch the data from the Document Store instead of IMAP

MessageReference.description: Message reference for a reply or a forward. This is EmailEngine specific ID, not Message-ID header value.

internalDate.description: Sets the internal date for this message

error.description: An error message if referenced message processing failed

ResponseReference.description: Reference info if referencing was requested

id.description: Message ID. NB! This and other fields might not be present if server did not provide enough information

path.description: Folder this message was uploaded to

SMTPEnvelope.description: Optional SMTP envelope. If not set then derived from message headers.

RenderValues.description: An object of variables for the template renderer

sendAt.description: Send message at specified time. Overrides message level `sendAt` value.

MailMergeList.description: Mail merge options. A separate email is generated for each recipient. Using mail merge disables `messageId`, `envelope`, `to`, `cc`, `bcc`, `render` keys for the message root.

raw.description: Base64 encoded email message in rfc822 format. If you provide other keys as well then these will override the values in the raw message.

previewText.description: Preview text appears in the inbox after the subject line

template.description: Stored template ID to load the email content from

trackingEnabled.description: Should EmailEngine track clicks and opens for this message

copy.description: If set then either copies the message to the Sent Mail folder or not. If not set then uses the account's default setting.

sentMailPath.description: Upload sent message to this folder. By default the account's Sent Mail folder is used.

deliveryAttempts.description: How many delivery attempts to make until message is considered as failed

gateway.description: Optional SMTP gateway ID for message routing

listId.description: List ID for Mail Merge. Must use a subdomain name format. Lists are registered ad-hoc, so a new identifier defines a new list.

dryRun.description: If true, then EmailEngine does not send the email and returns an RFC822 formatted email file. Tracking information is not added to the email.

documentStore.description: Was the message dat aloaded from the document store

success.description: Was the referenced message processed successfully

error.description: An error message if referenced message processing failed

Model20.description: Reference info if referencing was requested

skipped.description: Info about skipped message. If this value is set, then the message was not sent

success.description: Was the referenced message processed successfully

queueId.description: Queue identifier for scheduled email. Not present for bulk messages.

sendAt.description: Send message at specified time. Overrides message level `sendAt` value.

messageId.description: Message-ID header value. Not present for bulk messages.

queueId.description: Queue identifier for scheduled email. Not present for bulk messages.

preview.description: Base64 encoded RFC822 email if a preview was requested

deleted.description: Was the address removed from the list

accounts.description: The number of accounts registered with this application. Not available for legacy apps.

moved.description: Present if message was moved to Trash

useAuthServer.description: Set to true to use authentication server instead of username/password

secure.description: Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 993

disabled.description: Set to true to disable IMAP handling

partial.description: Update only listed keys in the imap config

sentMailPath.description: Upload sent message to this folder. By default the account's Sent Mail folder is used. Set to `null` to unset.

draftsMailPath.description: Folder for drafts. By default the account's Draft Mail folder is used. Set to `null` to unset.

junkMailPath.description: Folder for spam. By default the account's Junk Mail folder is used. Set to `null` to unset.

trashMailPath.description: Folder for deleted emails. By default the account's Trash folder is used. Set to `null` to unset.

useAuthServer.description: Set to true to use authentication server instead of username/password

secure.description: Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 465

partial.description: Update only listed keys in the smtp config

authorize.description: Return a redirect link to the OAuth2 consent screen

authority.description: Outloook account type. Either 'consumers', 'organizations', 'common' or an organizartion ID

partial.description: Update only listed keys in the oauth2 config

email.description: Default email address of the account

path.description: Check changes only on selected path

copy.description: Copy submitted messages to Sent folder. Set to `null` to unset and use provider specific default.

notifyFrom.description: Send webhooks for messages starting from provided date. The default is the account creation date.

syncFrom.description: Sync messages to document store starting from provided date. If not set, all emails are synced.

clientId.description: Client or Application ID for 3-legged OAuth2 applications

serviceClient.description: Service client ID for 2-legged OAuth2 applications

serviceKey.description: PEM formatted service secret for 2-legged OAuth2 applications

authority.description: Authorization tenant value for Outlook OAuth2 applications

TargetMailboxPath.description: New mailbox path as an array or a string. If account is namespaced then namespace prefix is added by default.

secure.description: Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 465

updated.description: Was the template updated or not

idMap.description: An optional map of source and target ID values, if the server provided this info

Model28.description: Present if messages were moved to Trash
